repnme.cdata!:
Bolivia, Ecuador, and Peru  Adaptation to
            the Impact of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Adaptation to the Impact
            of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes Project for
            Bolivia, Ecuador, and Peru were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned are as follows:  Careful, early-planned
            partnerships with key stakeholders increases the viability
            and chances of Project success. Climate change adaptation
            requires extensive bottom-up work and community development.
            The ability of countries to increase their climate change
            resilience is directly linked to their capacity to generate
            and analyze data to assess vulnerability. Different
            implementation arrangements should be considered and
            included in the legal agreements for flexibility.

repnme.cdata!:
Andean Countries - Adaptation to the Impact
            of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The broad development objective of the
            Adaptation to the Impact of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the
            Tropical Andes Project is to contribute to strengthening the
            resilience of local ecosystems and economies to the impacts
            of glacier retreat in the Tropical Andes, through the
            implementation of specific pilot adaptation activities that
            illustrate the costs and benefits of adaptation. The closing
            date of the project will be extended to September 30, 2013.
            The current restructuring only seeks a one-year extension to
            ensure adequate project implementation, with no other
            changes to the project. As such, the appraisal
            considerations included in the 2011 restructuring remain
            valid. Granting a one-year extension will allow for adequate
            dissemination of success stories and will ultimately help
            countries attract extra funds towards critical sectors
            likely impacted by climate change. The extension will
            further allow consolidation of methodologies, dissemination
            of lessons and knowledge sharing.

Andean Countries - Adaptation to
            the Impact of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes

repnme.cdata!:
Andean Countries - Adaptation to the Impact
            of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Adaptation to the Impact of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the
            Tropical Andes Project is to contribute to strengthening the
            resilience of local ecosystems and economies to the impacts
            of glacier retreat in the Tropical Andes. Good progress has
            been achieved overall in the generation of scientific
            knowledge and capacity strengthening on climate change and
            glacier monitoring. Climate change scenarios have been
            generated in Peru and Ecuador, and are being elaborated in
            Bolivia, and models have been developed to assess impacts on
            the water and agricultural sectors in selected areas of the
            participating countries. The Mid Term Review (MTR) of the
            project identified the need to restructure the project. This
            paper presents the restructuring, which entails: (i)
            creation of the regional knowledge sharing among the
            Beneficiaries (Plurinational State of Bolivia, Republic of
            Ecuador, and Republic of Peru); (ii) reorganization of
            project components, (iii) adjustment of some pilot
            adaptation measures, without changing the objective; (iv)
            adjustment of the results framework; (v) reallocation of
            proceeds to fit the revised project structure; and (vi)
            updating the project cost estimates and financing plan. A
            work plan outlining the activities to be completed by
            project closure has been agreed upon by the implementing
            agency and the beneficiaries. The changes do not affect the
            scope of the project or it's Project Development
            Objective (PDO). They are intended to better reflect the
            nature of the project, which is innovative and unique in
            many aspects. It is not a traditional infrastructure or
            agriculture or water project, although it involves all those
            sectors. As such, the importance of the whole process
            carried out throughout the life of the Project is being stressed.

display_title.display_title:
Andean Countries - Adaptation to
            the Impact of Rapid Glacier Retreat in the Tropical Andes
            Project : restructuring : Main report
